ygData.subject: RE: Bard Handicap of Sorts
ygData.msgSnippet: I m sure the confusion comes from our unwritten job description:  Bards, the corpse recovery experts. :-) Taneran Dreamweaver  Bard of the 30th song
ygData.messageBody:
I'm sure the confusion comes from our unwritten job description: Bards, the
corpse recovery experts. :-)


Taneran Dreamweaver
<Clan Jax>
Bard of the 30th song
Prexus

> -----Original Message-----
> From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 10:53 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Handicap of Sorts
>
>
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> Ahhh - I think you are right! I have a key set to sent multiple commands
> (you need special equipment to do this - 3rd party joystick & programmable
> throttle www.ch-products.com <http://www.ch-products.com> ) and
> on pallette
> 4, I have move forward and /corpse linked - so I can run drag
> corpses in one
> key stroke.
>
> And now that you mention it, I distinctly remember seeing both
> "you have no
> corpses in this zone" (hmm, nice but what zone is it in?) and "that corpse
> is too far away to summon" right after entering zones on the daily corpse
> hunt.
>
> My confusion was from the need to target before dragging someone else's
> corpse.
>
> Sylly Songsynger
> <Spirit of the Moon>
> Bard of the 37th song
> somewhere on Innoruuk
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jeff Illian [mailto:jeff@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 10:15 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Handicap of Sorts
>
> From: "Jeff Illian" <jeff@...>
>
> Actually, I'm ALMOST positive that you don't need to target
> your corpse for
> the /corpse command to work. You only need to target if it
> is not your
> corpse that you want to drag.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 10:01 AM
> > To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Handicap of Sorts
> >
> >
> > From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
> >
> > Hehe - been that long since you died last you have
> forgotten how /corpse
> > works? You need to target the corpse then /corpse to drag
> it -
>
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> lol@... with the subject submissions.
>
